Answer two questions. Candidates must use specific and clearly identified ethnographic illustrations.
Each question is worth [19 marks]. Up to an additional [6 marks] are awarded across both answers.

1.    Discuss the extent to which development programmes have altered one of the following:

      • human relationships with the environment
      • knowledge of health and illness
      • labour relations.


2.    Examine how people make social use of one of the following:

      • myth
      • ritual
      • art.


3.    Contrast the relationship between gender and power in two societies.


4.    Discuss globalization in relation to one of the following:

      • commodification
      • exchange systems
      • media and communication.


5.    Examine identity in relation to one of the following:

      • refugees
      • migration
      • indigenous peoples.


6.    Discuss ideology with reference to either religious movements or ethnic groups.


7.    Examine the importance of economic organization in one of the following:

      • kinship
      • moral systems
      • social movements.


8.    Examine the relationship between tourism and one of the following:

      • the environment
      • nation building
      • inequality.

10.   Examine the shift from production to consumption in the modern world.
